Articles.Content: So I have this satellite in a geo-orbit and was wondering if it is somehow possible to keep it faced in the direction of the planet? Not very satellity facing away from it every other orbit cycle.
SAS but it will only hold that direction while you are currently "flying" that craft. Other then that I do not know.

Unfortunately it's not possible as of today.

Warping kill any angular velocity, and you need some to keep pointing in a direction relative to your orbit.
Mechjeb can keep it pointed right at the planet.

So I have this satellite in a geo-orbit and was wondering if it is somehow possible to keep it faced in the direction of the planet? Not very satellity facing away from it every other orbit cycle.

Currently, it is not possible to place a rotation on the satellite that matched the orbital period. Perhaps, in a future update, that could be implemented in the ASAS controller.
